member.name: F:ManagedBass.ChannelAttribute.ReverseDirection
member.summary: Playback direction (-1 = Reverse or 1 = Forward).

member.name: F:ManagedBass.ChannelAttribute.MidiPPQN
member.summary:
BASSMIDI: Gets the Pulses Per Quarter Note (or ticks per beat) value of the MIDI file.
This attribute is the number of ticks per beat as defined by the MIDI file; it will be 0 for MIDI streams created via , It is read-only, so can't be modified via .

member.name: F:ManagedBass.ChannelAttribute.MidiCPU
member.summary:
BASSMIDI: The maximum percentage of CPU time that a MIDI stream can use... 0 to 100, 0 = unlimited.
It is not strictly the CPU usage that is measured, but rather how timely the stream is able to render data. For example, a limit of 50% would mean that the rendering would need to be at least 2x real-time speed. When the limit is exceeded, will begin killing voices, starting with the most quiet. When the CPU usage is limited, the stream's samples are loaded asynchronously so that any loading delays (eg. due to slow disk) do not hold up the stream for too long. If a sample cannot be loaded in time, then it will be silenced until it is available and the stream will continue playing other samples as normal in the meantime. This does not affect sample loading via , which always operates synchronously. By default, a MIDI stream will have no CPU limit.

member.name: F:ManagedBass.ChannelAttribute.MidiChannels
member.summary:
BASSMIDI: The number of MIDI channels in a MIDI stream... 1 (min) - 128 (max).
For a MIDI file stream, the minimum is 16. New channels are melodic by default. Any notes playing on a removed channel are immediately stopped.

member.name: F:ManagedBass.ChannelAttribute.MidiVoices
member.summary:
BASSMIDI: The maximum number of samples to play at a time (polyphony) in a MIDI stream... 1 (min) - 1000 (max).
If there are currently more voices active than the new limit, then some voices will be killed to meet the limit. The number of voices currently active is available via the Voices attribute. A MIDI stream will initially have a default number of voices as determined by the Voices config option.

member.name: F:ManagedBass.ChannelAttribute.MidiVoicesActive
member.summary:
BASSMIDI: The number of samples (voices) currently playing in a MIDI stream.
This attribute is read-only, so cannot be modified via .

member.name: F:ManagedBass.ChannelAttribute.MidiTrackVolume
member.summary:
BASSMIDI: The volume level (0.0=silent, 1.0=normal/default) of a track in a MIDI file stream + track#.
track#: The track to set the volume of... 0 = first track.
The volume curve used by this attribute is always linear, eg. 0.5 = 50%. The config option setting has no effect on this. During playback, the effect of changes to this attribute are not heard instantaneously, due to buffering. To reduce the delay, use the config option to reduce the Buffer Length. This attribute can also be used to count the number of tracks in a MIDI file stream. MIDI streams created via do not have any tracks.

member.name: F:ManagedBass.ChannelAttribute.OpusOriginalFrequency
member.summary:
BassOpus: The sample rate of an Opus stream's source material.
Opus streams always have a sample rate of 48000 Hz, and an Opus encoder will resample the source material to that if necessary. This attribute presents the original sample rate, which may be stored in the Opus file header. This attribute is read-only, so cannot be modified via .

member.name: F:ManagedBass.ChannelAttribute.DSDGain
member.summary: BassDSD: The gain (in decibels) applied when converting to PCM.
member.remarks: This attribute is only applicable when converting to PCM, and is unavailable when producing DSD-over-PCM or raw DSD data. The default setting is determined by the config option

member.name: F:ManagedBass.ChannelAttribute.DSDRate
member.summary: BassDSD: The DSD sample rate.
member.remarks: This attribute is read-only, so cannot be modified via .

member.name: F:ManagedBass.ChannelAttribute.MixerLatency
member.summary: BassMix: Custom output latency in seconds... default = 0 (no accounting for latency). Changes take immediate effect.
member.remarks: When a mixer is played by BASS, the , , , and functions will get the output latency and account for that so that they reflect what is currently being heard, but that cannot be done when a different output system is used, eg. ASIO or WASAPI. In that case, this attribute can be used to tell the mixer what the output latency is, so that those functions can still account for it. The mixer needs to have the and flags set to use this attribute.

member.name: F:ManagedBass.DeviceInitFlags.ForcedSpeakerAssignment
member.summary: Force enabling of speaker assignment (always 8 speakers will be used regardless if the soundcard supports them). Only use this option if BASS doesn't detect the correct number of supported speakers automatically and you want to force BASS to use 8 speakers.

member.summary: Midi Add-On: Let the old sound decay naturally (including reverb) when changing the position, including looping and such can also be used in calls to have it apply to particular position changes.

member.summary: MOD Music Flag: Stop all notes when moving position.

member.name: F:ManagedBass.PositionFlags.MixerNoRampIn
member.summary: Mixer Flag: Don't ramp-in the start after seeking.

member.name: F:ManagedBass.PositionFlags.Inexact
member.summary: Flag: Allow inexact seeking. For speed, seeking may stop at the beginning of a block rather than partially processing the block to reach the requested position.

member.name: F:ManagedBass.PositionFlags.Decode
member.summary: Get the decoding (not playing) position.

member.name: F:ManagedBass.PositionFlags.DecodeTo
member.summary: Flag: decode to the position instead of seeking.

member.name: F:ManagedBass.PositionFlags.Scan
member.summary: Scan the file to build a seek table up to the position, if it has not already been scanned. Scanning will continue from where it left off previously rather than restarting from the beginning of the file each time. This flag only applies to MP3/MP2/MP1 files and will be ignored with other file formats.

member.name: T:ManagedBass.StreamProcedureType
member.summary: flag used with resp. used with a User sample stream to be used with .

member.name: F:ManagedBass.StreamProcedureType.End
member.summary: Flag to signify that the end of the stream is reached.

member.name: F:ManagedBass.StreamProcedureType.Push
member.summary: Create a "push" stream. Instead of BASS pulling data from a StreamProcedure function, data is pushed to BASS via .

member.name: F:ManagedBass.StreamProcedureType.Dummy
member.summary: Create a "dummy" stream. A dummy stream doesn't have any sample data of its own, but a decoding dummy stream (with flag) can be used to apply DSP/FX processing to any sample data, by setting DSP/FX on the stream and feeding the data through . The dummy stream should have the same sample format as the data being fed through it.

member.summary:
Unbuffered file system (like also used by ).
The unbuffered file system is what is used by . In this system, BASS does not do any intermediate buffering - it simply requests data from the file as and when it needs it. This means that reading () must be quick, otherwise the decoding will be delayed and playback Buffer underruns (old data repeated) are a possibility. It's not so important for seeking () to be fast, as that is generally not required during decoding, except when looping a file.

member.name: F:ManagedBass.StreamSystem.Buffer
member.summary:
Buffered file system (like also used by ).
The buffered file system is what is used by . As the name suggests, data from the file is buffered so that it's readily available for decoding - BASS creates a thread dedicated to "downloading" the data. This is ideal for when the data is coming from a source that has high latency, like the internet. It's not possible to seek in buffered file streams, until the download has reached the requested position - it's not possible to seek at all if it's being streamed in blocks.

member.name: F:ManagedBass.StreamSystem.BufferPush
member.summary:
Buffered, with the data pushed to BASS via .
The push buffered file system is the same as , except that instead of the file data being pulled from the function in a "download" thread, the data is pushed to BASS via . A function is still required, to get the initial data used in the creation of the stream.

member.name: T:ManagedBass.SyncFlags
member.summary: Sync types to be used with (param flag) and (data flag).

member.name: F:ManagedBass.SyncFlags.Onetime
member.summary: FLAG: sync only once, else continuously

member.name: F:ManagedBass.SyncFlags.Mixtime
member.summary: FLAG: sync at mixtime, else at playtime

member.name: F:ManagedBass.SyncFlags.Position
member.summary: Sync when a channel reaches a position. param : position in bytes data : not used

member.name: F:ManagedBass.SyncFlags.MusicInstrument
member.summary: Sync when an instrument (sample for the non-instrument based formats) is played in a MOD music (not including retrigs). param : LOWORD=instrument (1=first) HIWORD=note (0=c0...119=b9, -1=all) data : LOWORD=note HIWORD=volume (0-64)

member.name: F:ManagedBass.SyncFlags.End
member.summary: Sync when a channel reaches the end. param : not used data : 1 = the sync is triggered by a backward jump in a MOD music, otherwise not used

member.name: F:ManagedBass.SyncFlags.MusicFx
member.summary: Sync when the "sync" effect (XM/MTM/MOD: E8x/Wxx, IT/S3M: S2x) is used. param : 0:data=Position, 1:data="x" value data : param=0: LOWORD=order HIWORD=row, param=1: "x" value

member.name: F:ManagedBass.SyncFlags.MetadataReceived
member.summary: Sync when metadata is received in a stream. param : not used data : not used - the updated metadata is available from

member.name: F:ManagedBass.SyncFlags.Slided
member.summary: Sync when an attribute slide is completed. param : not used data : the Type of slide completed (one of the values)

member.name: F:ManagedBass.SyncFlags.Stalled
member.summary: Sync when playback has stalled. param : not used data : 0=stalled, 1=resumed

member.name: F:ManagedBass.SyncFlags.Downloaded
member.summary: Sync when downloading of an internet (or "buffered" User file) stream has ended. param : not used data : not used

member.name: F:ManagedBass.SyncFlags.Free
member.summary: Sync when a channel is freed. param : not used data : not used

member.name: F:ManagedBass.SyncFlags.MusicPosition
member.summary: Sync when a MOD music reaches an order:row position. param : LOWORD=order (0=first, -1=all) HIWORD=row (0=first, -1=all) data : LOWORD=order HIWORD=row

member.name: F:ManagedBass.SyncFlags.Seeking
member.summary: Sync when seeking (inc. looping and restarting). So it could be used to reset DSP/etc. param : position in bytes data : 0=playback is unbroken, 1=if is it broken (eg. Buffer flushed). The latter would be the time to reset DSP/etc.

member.name: F:ManagedBass.SyncFlags.OggChange
member.summary: Sync when a new logical bitstream begins in a chained OGG stream. Updated tags are available from . param : not used data : not used

member.name: F:ManagedBass.SyncFlags.Stop
member.summary: Sync when the DirectSound Buffer fails during playback, eg. when the device is no longer available. param : not used data : not used

member.name: F:ManagedBass.SyncFlags.WinampBitRate
member.summary: WINAMP add-on: Sync when bitrate is changed or retrieved from a winamp Input plug-in. param : not used data : the bitrate retrieved from the winamp Input plug-in - called when it is retrieved or changed (VBR MP3s, OGGs, etc).

member.name: F:ManagedBass.SyncFlags.CDError
member.summary: CD add-on: Sync when playback is stopped due to an error. For example, the drive door being opened. param : not used data : the position that was being read from the CD track at the time.

member.name: F:ManagedBass.SyncFlags.CDSpeed
member.summary: CD add-on: Sync when the read speed is automatically changed due to the BassCd.AutoSpeedReduction setting. param : not used data : the new read speed.

member.name: F:ManagedBass.SyncFlags.MidiMarker
member.summary: MIDI add-on: Sync when a marker is encountered. param : not used data : the marker index, which can be used in a call.

member.name: F:ManagedBass.SyncFlags.MidiCue
member.summary: MIDI add-on: Sync when a cue is encountered. param : not used data : the marker index, which can be used in a call.

member.name: F:ManagedBass.SyncFlags.MidiLyric
member.summary: MIDI add-on: Sync when a lyric event is encountered. param : not used data : the marker index, which can be used in a call. If the text begins with a '/' (slash) character, a new line should be started. If it begins with a '\' (backslash) character, the display should be cleared.

member.name: F:ManagedBass.SyncFlags.MidiText
member.summary: MIDI add-on: Sync when a text event is encountered. param : not used data : the marker index, which can be used in a call. Lyrics can sometimes be found in instead of markers.

member.name: F:ManagedBass.SyncFlags.MidiEvent
member.summary: MIDI add-on: Sync when a Type of event is processed, in either a MIDI file or . param : event Type (0 = all types). data : LOWORD = event parameter, HIWORD = channel (high 8 bits contain the event Type when syncing on all types). See for a list of event types and their parameters.

member.name: F:ManagedBass.SyncFlags.MidiTick
member.summary: MIDI add-on: Sync when reaching a tick position. param : tick position. data : not used

member.name: F:ManagedBass.SyncFlags.MidiTimeSignature
member.summary: MIDI add-on: Sync when a time signature event is processed. param : event Type. data : The time signature events are given (by ) in the form of "numerator/denominator metronome-pulse 32nd-notes-per-MIDI-quarter-note", eg. "4/4 24 8".

member.name: F:ManagedBass.SyncFlags.MidiKeySignature
member.summary: MIDI add-on: Sync when a key signature event is processed. param : event Type. data : The key signature events are given (by ) in the form of "a b", where a is the number of sharps (if positive) or flats (if negative), and b signifies major (if 0) or minor (if 1).

member.name: F:ManagedBass.SyncFlags.WmaChange
member.summary: WMA add-on: Sync on a track change in a server-side playlist. Updated tags are available via . param : not used data : not used

member.name: F:ManagedBass.SyncFlags.WmaMeta
member.summary: WMA add-on: Sync on a mid-stream tag change in a server-side playlist. Updated tags are available via . param : not used data : not used - the updated metadata is available from .

member.name: F:ManagedBass.SyncFlags.MixerEnvelope
member.summary: MIX add-on: Sync when an envelope reaches the end. param : not used data : envelope Type

member.name: F:ManagedBass.SyncFlags.MixerEnvelopeNode
member.summary: MIX add-on: Sync when an envelope node is reached. param : Optional limit the sync to a certain envelope Type (one of the BASSMIXEnvelope values). data : Will contain the envelope Type in the LOWORD and the current node number in the HIWORD.

member.name: F:ManagedBass.SyncFlags.HlsSegement
member.summary: Sync when a new segment begins downloading. Mixtime only. param: not used. data: not used.

member.name: F:ManagedBass.TagType.ID3

member.name: F:ManagedBass.TagType.OGG
member.summary: OGG comments : Only available when streaming an OGG file. A pointer to a series of null-terminated UTF-8 strings is returned, the final string ending with a double null.

member.name: F:ManagedBass.TagType.HTTP
member.summary: HTTP headers : Only available when streaming from a HTTP server. A pointer to a series of null-terminated ANSI strings is returned, the final string ending with a double null.

member.name: F:ManagedBass.TagType.ICY
member.summary: ICY headers : A pointer to a series of null-terminated ANSI strings is returned, the final string ending with a double null.

member.name: F:ManagedBass.TagType.META
F:ManagedBass.TagType.APE

member.name: F:ManagedBass.TagType.MP4
member.summary: iTunes/MP4 metadata : Only available when streaming a MP4 file. A pointer to a series of null-terminated UTF-8 strings is returned, the final string ending with a double null.

member.name: F:ManagedBass.TagType.WMA

member.name: F:ManagedBass.TagType.OggEncoder
member.summary: OGG encoder : A single null-terminated UTF-8 string.

member.name: F:ManagedBass.TagType.Lyrics3v2

member.summary: WMA mid-stream tag: a single UTF-8 string.

member.summary: WMA codec: A description of the codec used by the file. 2 null-terminated UTF-8 strings are returned, with the 1st string being the name of the codec, and the 2nd containing additional information like what VBR setting was used.

member.name: T:ManagedBass.VAMMode
member.summary: Voice allocation management flags. These flags enable hardware resource stealing... if the hardware has no available voices, a currently playing Buffer will be stopped to make room for the new Buffer.
member.remarks: NOTE: only samples loaded/created with the flag are considered for termination by the DX7 voice management.

member.name: F:ManagedBass.VAMMode.Hardware
member.summary: Play the sample in hardware (default). If no hardware voices are available then the "play" call will fail.

member.name: F:ManagedBass.VAMMode.Software
member.summary: Play the sample in software (ie. non-accelerated). No other VAM flags may be used together with this flag.

member.name: F:ManagedBass.VAMMode.TerminateTime
member.summary: If there are no free hardware voices, the Buffer to be terminated will be the one with the least time left to play.

member.name: F:ManagedBass.VAMMode.TerminateDistance
member.summary: If there are no free hardware voices, the Buffer to be terminated will be one that was loaded/created with the flag and is beyond it's max distance. If there are no buffers that match this criteria, then the "play" call will fail.

member.name: F:ManagedBass.VAMMode.TerminatePriority
member.summary: If there are no free hardware voices, the Buffer to be terminated will be the one with the lowest priority.

member.name: F:ManagedBass.WaveFormatTag.MPEG_ADTS_AAC
member.summary: Advanced Audio Coding (AAC) audio in Audio Data Transport Stream (ADTS) format. The format block is a WAVEFORMATEX structure with wFormatTag equal to WAVE_FORMAT_MPEG_ADTS_AAC.
member.remarks: The WAVEFORMATEX structure specifies the core AAC-LC sample rate and number of channels, prior to applying spectral band replication (SBR) or parametric stereo (PS) tools, if present. No additional data is required after the WAVEFORMATEX structure.

member.name: F:ManagedBass.WaveFormatTag.MPEG_LOAS
member.summary: MPEG-4 audio transport stream with a synchronization layer (LOAS) and a multiplex layer (LATM). The format block is a WAVEFORMATEX structure with wFormatTag equal to WAVE_FORMAT_MPEG_LOAS.
member.remarks: The WAVEFORMATEX structure specifies the core AAC-LC sample rate and number of channels, prior to applying spectral SBR or PS tools, if present. No additional data is required after the WAVEFORMATEX structure.

member.name: T:ManagedBass.BassInfo
member.summary: Used with to retrieve information on the current device.
member.remarks:
The DSCAPS_SECONDARY flags only indicate which sample formats are supported by hardware mixing.
Platform-specific
On Windows, it is possible for speakers to mistakenly be 2 with some devices/drivers when the device in fact supports more speakers. In that case, the flag can be used (with ) to use the Windows control panel setting, or the flag can be used to force the enabling of speaker assignment to up to 8 speakers, even though the device may not really support that many speakers. The result of assigning channels to nonexistent speakers is undefined; they may be heard on other speakers or not heard at all.
The flags, hwsize, hwfree, freesam, free3d, minrate, maxrate, eax, and dsver members are only used on Windows, as DirectSound and hardware mixing are only available there. The freq member is not available on Windows prior to Vista.
On Windows, the availability of the latency and minbuf values depends on the flag being used when was called.

member.name: T:ManagedBass.ChannelInfo
member.summary: Used with to retrieve information on a channel.
member.remarks:
A "channel" can be a playing sample (HCHANNEL), a sample stream (HSTREAM), a MOD music (HMUSIC), or a recording (HRECORD).
Each "Channel" function can be used with one or more of these channel types.
The BassFlags.SoftwareMixing flag indicates whether or not the channel's sample data is being mixed into the final output by the hardware. It does not indicate (in the case of a stream or MOD music) whether the processing required to generate the sample data is being done by the hardware, this processing is always done in software.
BASS supports 8/16/32-bit sample data, so if a WAV file, for example, uses another sample resolution, it'll have to be converted by BASS. The member can be used to check what the resolution originally was.

member.name: P:ManagedBass.ChannelInfo.Frequency

remarks.para: On Linux/iOS/OSX, the flag may not be present even if it was used in the stream's creation, as BASS will have translated the filename to the native UTF-8 form. On Windows CE, the opposite is true: the flag may be present even if it was not used in the stream's creation, as BASS will have translated the filename to the native UTF-16 form.

member.name: T:ManagedBass.DeviceInfo
member.summary: Used with or to retrieve information on a device.

remarks.para: When a device is disabled/disconnected, it is still retained in the device list, but the IsEnabled is set to flag is removed from it. If the device is subsequently re-enabled, it may become available again with the same device number, or the system may add a new entry for it.

When a new device is connected, it can affect the other devices and result in the system moving them to new device entries. If an affected device is initialized, it will stop working and will need to be reinitialized using its new device number.

On Windows, can reveal the Type of driver being used on systems that support both VxD and WDM drivers (Windows Me/98SE). Further information can be obtained from the file via the GetFileVersionInfo function. On Vista and newer, the device's endpoint ID is given rather than its driver filename. On OSX, driver is the device's UID, and on Linux it is the ALSA device name. It is unused on other platforms. The device Type is only available on Windows (Vista and newer) and OSX. On Windows, DisplayPort devices will have rather than .
Depending on the Bass.UnicodeDeviceInformation config setting, and can be in ANSI or UTF-8 form on Windows. They are always in UTF-16 form on Windows CE, and UTF-8 on other platforms.

member.name: P:ManagedBass.DeviceInfo.Name

member.name: P:ManagedBass.DeviceInfo.Driver
member.summary:
The filename of the driver being used... = no driver (ie. device).
On systems that can use both VxD and WDM drivers (Windows Me/98SE), this will reveal which Type of driver is being used.
Further information can be obtained from the file using the GetFileVersionInfo Win32 API function.

member.name: T:ManagedBass.RecordInfo
member.summary: Used with to retrieve information on the current recording device.

remarks.para: The member does not represent all the formats supported by the device, just the "standard" ones.
If there is no DirectSound driver for the device (ie. it's being emulated), then the driver member will contain something like "WaveIn" instead of a filename.

The and members are only used on Windows. The member is only used on Windows/OSX/iOS, and only for the device's channel count in the case of OSX and iOS. On Windows, it does not necessarily represent all of the formats supported by the device, just the "standard" ones. is also only available on Windows/OSX/iOS, but not on Windows prior to Vista.

member.name: T:ManagedBass.SampleInfo
member.summary: Used with and to retrieve and set the default playback attributes of a sample.

remarks.para: When a sample has 3D functionality, the and angles decide how wide the sound is projected around the orientation angle (as set via ). Within the inside angle the volume level is the level set in the volume member (or the attribute when the sample is playing). Outside the outer angle, the volume changes according to the outvol value. Between the inner and outer angles, the volume gradually changes between the inner and outer volume levels. If the inner and outer angles are 360 degrees, then the sound is transmitted equally in all directions.
When VAM is enabled, and neither the or flags are specified, then the sample will be played in hardware if resources are available, and in software if no hardware resources are available.

remarks.para: An external library is loaded into memory when any of its methods are called for the first time. This results in the first method call being slower than all subsequent calls.

Some BASS libraries and add-ons may introduce new options to the main BASS lib like new parameters. But, before using these new options the respective library must be already loaded. This method can be used to make sure, that this library has been loaded.

member.name: T:ManagedBass.BassMp4
member.summary: BassAac support for Mp4

member.name: M:ManagedBass.BassMp4.Load(System.String)
member.summary: Load this library into Memory.
member.param: Directory to Load from... (default) = Load from Current Directory.
member.returns: , if the library loaded successfully, else .

remarks.para: An external library is loaded into memory when any of its methods are called for the first time. This results in the first method call being slower than all subsequent calls.

Some BASS libraries and add-ons may introduce new options to the main BASS lib like new parameters. But, before using these new options the respective library must be already loaded. This method can be used to make sure, that this library has been loaded.
